reviews: We just got back from our first trip to Mexico City and luckily, at the last minute we changed our hotel to the Camino Real.  And boy, are we glad we did. From a practical point of view, the hotels location is ideal, close enough to all the major sites and museums, but with just enough distance to be an oasis at the end of the day. My wife especially enjoyed the (heated) pool. while my 16 yr old son hit the gym every day. They have several restaurants and bars on sight, to be honest, we ate out most of the time, but I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet the one time we ate there. I had the Mexican dishes which were really good. My son thought the more traditional US food was so so. We were not pleased with our first room choice. We mentioned this right away and we were quickly

Camino Real was a great choice for us as a family needing 3 rooms. The staff is very friendly and the renovated rooms are lovely. We especially appreciated the gym and took advantage of several onsite restaurants. The location is great if you're visiting the museums and the park but with CDMX traffic, traveling to Zocolo and the historic sites is time consuming from here.

Interesting place. Decided to give a second chance. Wish I didn’t   Place looks really tired and old fashioned. Check in was good. Once we were in our room the whole thing changed. We were placed in a room with absolutely no view. Yes. No view. And I’m not talking a roof or so. Place has no view. Not good if you at least like to see the sky.   Room is modest to say the least. I think this hotel carries and survives by reputation of better years.   Food at the restaurant ( Huerta? ) was not at adequate temperature. We decided to finish. We were starving.   Today we decided to stay in bed till 8 am. Impossible ! Every time someone uses the bathroom and shower, pipes make so much noise that is impossible to stay in rest.   Bathroom has no absorption of odor nor steam so if you take

I stayed at Camino Real Polanco and my stay was amazing . Thanks To Mr. Kirnbauer GM and his staff I had a very nice stay. The room was spacious and impeccable and the location was perfect. Close to main attractions and most important I felt safe. The taxi pick up  area is inside the hotel which I thought was brilliant. Thanks again for making a rather stressful and quick travel so much easier!! I recommend this hotel if you are looking to find relaxation and great sleep in a busy place like Mexico City.

The location of the hotel and the breakfast are excellent. Rooms are very old and you have to walk a lot in order to reach your room. The corredors and the room are quite dark. There is a missing lightning everywhere. Clearly saving energy is very appreciated but new technology allows to get low consumption of energy and provide good quality of light

Added 1 extra night to the booking and they changed the tariff for the other 2 nights costing me an extra us100.. bar staff always expected tip but service was mediocre.. nice hotel but badly managed.

Excellent service. Very quiet hotel. Good location. Lots of space. The architecture is unique and the staff are helpful.  Very good to have an ATM in the hotel and free WiFi. The gym and outdoor terrace were great additions too!

Over the last 40 years I have stayed at this hotel probably on average of 2 weeks @ year, excepting the last ten years when my travels did not take me to CDMX.  However, after a ten year hiatus, am happy to say the standards of the hotel have not suffered.  The title of this piece says almost everything you need to know.  The breakfast buffet is one of the very best I have experienced anywhere in the world.

I had business in Mexico City & stayed for two days after a conference there, so I actually found it a good base for exploring the city. The rooms are boring corporate, but they have everything you need & are very clean and not expensive. The hotel absorbs people so despite hundreds of rooms it did not feel crowded. There’s a good pool.The architecture is supposedly by a famous Mexican architect, and features water. The concierges are extremely helpful, & went above & beyond to help us when we had a phone disaster. In fact all staff were friendly.  Not everything works however- like their credit card machines. Food is overpriced & not great value

Service staff means well and they try to do a good job but hotel management has no appreciation for guests. The hotel is very dated, rooms are old and run down. The check-in process is painful - the check-in staff are loathed to process your stay. This place is stuck in the 1970's. You can do a lot better.

this hotel feels like a cheap all inclusive. Not personal and the cost in restaurants is ridiculous, $30USD for breakfast!! I walked outside and found a caffe for 10% of this. it is vast and cold (not in temperature) it is a really strange hotel and won't be going back.

Historic building because of Luis Barragan but services in general are terrible, especially the front desk.  This is quite expensive hotel but you have to pay extra even for bathroom robes or slippers, can you imagine? Rooms are clean but old and need to be refreshed.  For the money that they charge  per night is definitely not worthy compare to other hotels available in Polanco.  Total disappointment.

I really liked the area where the hotel is, the lobby area and the bar downstairs, however it is an old building and the smell was not very nice. In the area where I was staying they were doing some repair and modifications, so during the day they had noise, which was not pleasant. Also, the building is too large and the service is very slow, even though you do see a lot of staff wandering round, if you ask for help, they dont necessarily give it. That also happened during breakfast, where they had many waiters but to get coffee from them for a second time it was quite the challenge, they were mostly cheking if you had already signed the receipt from breakfast. For the fare we paid, I dont consider this a good deal, I suggest you improve service and speed.

. I am a long time customer of Camino Real chain but this was my first visit to the one located in Polanco Mexico City. Probably the best bathroom ive seen in years, confortable bed, decent breakfast buffet all would point out to a five star review BUT for one small but crucial detail; they decided to go against common sense and general practice in the industry and took away the cofee pot in the room. It ruined my morning routine  and when i complained at front desk they told me there was nothing they could do..Apalled

Is a really good hotel! My family and I stayed there for a few days and we really enojoyed the service, we felt really confortable and our rooms were confortable too. The hotel looks great inside and outside, we loved it!

Our party of 9 booked several rooms at the Camino Real Polanco and we were all very happy that we had chosen this property for our 5-day visit to CDMX. First, the architecture is stunning and who can complain about the amazing artwork by Rufino Tamayo in the lobby?  Our rooms were all renovated and the Mexican hospitality we received from most of the staff....rooms attendants, porters, front door staff...was beyond gracious. Only the front desk check in staff were not very friendly, perhaps because this hotel is primarily a business hotel and our group was there on vacation. All meals we had, whether room service or in one of the restaurants, were excellent.  The concierge was excellent, able to arrange for in-room massages within one hour! Finally, the location could not be

We really enjoyed this hotel -- clean, comfortable, friendly staff and great breakfast buffet. The architecture and art are interesting and the location is great. You can walk to many museums and tourist sites, which is definitely an advantage in Mexico City.  Our room had a nice patio, overlooking the courtyard. My only small complaint is that the housekeeping was a little inconsistent.  When we arrived, there were no shampoos in the bathroom and one day, they took the dirty towels away but didn't replace them.  But that was minor and it was rectified quickly when we asked for the items. Overall, a good experience.

We did not engage a single employee here that was not friendly and helpful. Everyone mentions the art here, but it was lost on me. The hotel was clean, our room comfortable. The bathroom layout was odd, but nice shower with plenty of hot water and good toiletries. Several restaurants if you don't want to go out. We appreciated La Huerta with buffet or table service. Great location--across from entrance to Chapultapec Park with its variety of museums, lakes, zoo, and Chapultapec Castle. Lots of places to walk or run in the Park and around the hotel there are many shops, restaurants and convenience stores like Circle K where bottled water, soft drinks and snacks are cheap.

The historical nature of this hotel, and architectural significance, are undeniable and make up for a lot of the experience. I went for Zona Maco. Was disappointed that even though they had rooms available, they would not let me check in early without paying an extra US$200. Really. The renovated room was actually quite nice - marble bathroom and all - but the large-screen TV was not level, by far. Bell-staff were diligent . This hotel is being renovated and they are reasonably discreet with how they handle that. I would only go if the price is reasonable.

We stayed at this hotel for the recent Zona Maco art fair. We had previously booked one of the cute boutique hotels in Polanco but when we saw this hotel we moved immediately. First of all, it is a beautiful hotel with gorgeous, art-filled spaces. The location is excellent, in walking distance of the best museums and a short car ride (except in Mexico City's horrific rush hour traffic) of the good restaurants in Roma and La Condesa. The original rooms are spacious and stunning, with great bathrooms and lovely details like original wood closets. Ours looked out over a lovely courtyard with a pool that people were actually swimming laps in every morning. I recommend spending a little extra for the Club level rooms (about $60 USD) and having breakfast included in the 5th floor VIP

Love this hotel. It is classic beautiful architecture and a very nice area of Polanco walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants. My only complaint is about the beds. The double beds made it tight for family of four and the charge for an extra bed was almost half the cost of the room. They need to either get queen beds or make the charge for the extra bed nominal. Otherwise this is a great traditional hotel with amazing service and friendly staff.

Amazing place, great service! Loved the room and staff. Would definitely recommend this place. If you want to get to know Mexico, great place to stay at, close to restaurants and bars, great location overall 🤩 best place to hang out too ! Awesome job !

Service was terrible and the Wi-Fi in the room was very weak. At the last day, had to wait a long time to get hot water in the shower. There was some confusion with the room locking system and I had to walk back and forth to get a card that opened the room.

Excellent food and superb service! The restaurant is really open and nice. The food suuuper delicious and the service spot on. Victor the Manager makes sure that everything runs smoothly and is very attentive. Our servers, Joasim and Miguel were very attentive to us and bringing our coffees and replacing our plates constantly . I can only give them 5 stars but I would give them 8!!! Please give La Huerta a try and come for breakfast very hungry since it’s a buffet ! :-)

I had to stay in a worse room than I booked because the room I originally reserved had some acoustic isolation problem. After waking up for the fifth time at night due to some noise of something hitting the wall I asked to exchange my bedroom. I was offered a worse one or I could pay the double for a better one. The new room also had acoustic isolation problems, I would always wake up with the noise of the alarm of the bedroom next door. It was explained to me that is due to the fact that the bedrooms were connected through a door.

Cannot rate this hotel higher for their hospitality and assistance during a 2 week stay.  The cleaners are relentlessly working all hours to ensure hygiene levels are maintained.  Room was perfect for what I require with Molton Brown toiletries being a lovely touch.    The concierge were lovely and very, very helpful.

The hotel has an excellent location for the paperwork I need to do.  It also is at walking distance from several restaurants, and stores. It is very clean, safe, and confortable.  La Huerta is the hotel restaurant,  very convenient for breakfast. I will come back here again.

When I stay in a hotel in Mexico City, I usually do it here.  The hotel is undergoing renovation as it is a bit old.  But the location, the hotel service, the dining options make this hotel unique.  The cost benefit ratio is another of the things that make it unique.

This is a beautiful hotel located in the quiet Anzures area of Mexico City. It's located only a few minutes away by foot from Chapultepec forest. The staff here are very helpful, and the property adheres to COVID regulation/sanitation seriously. Their room service also was very quick! I loved our stay here, and highly recommend this hotel! A big thank you to Gustavo at the concierge as well.

This is a great area for convenience of restaurant, bars and local markets.  I also enjoyed a nice walk through the local parks (a short 5-minute walk away) and a relaxing morning by the pool.  The best part of my stay was the attentive staff in a hotel that, while having all of the modern amenities, still feels uniquely Mexican.

This was my first visit to Mexico City and I can't imagine enjoying my visit more than I did- and staying at the Camino Real Polanco was a primary reason why. My room was spotless, spacious, and well-appointed. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful, and very patient when I had difficulty with Spanish- my Spanish is terrible! The hotel's location is fantastic being so close to places to eat, places to get a coffee, and more. I especially enjoyed how close it was to Chapultepec Park- which was also absolutely incredible to visit.

7-day stay planned in JSuite but great disappointment and voluntary decommissioning and arranged very kindly by the reception. Fantastic and vintage museum hotel... Impeccable service at the club (Thank you Jesus) but breakfast less well than at the main restaurant (paying even if you are at the Club level!! ... incomprehensible! ...) Director Mr Stephano is very present and attentive to satisfy customers... Our room on level 5 was perfect and clean, very good bedding, impeccable bathroom and cleaning... the pool is a must but saturated the WE... it is well maintained... A very positive stay overall and even if everything is not perfect, the kindness of the staff makes the difference... we will come back...

Stayed few days at Camino Real Polanco for work. I first tried to contact them beforehand and was tough to get any feedback (you know those chatbots 😖).   Place is fine, very big / impersonal but fine.  Rooms were a bit noisy at night with sound from the street, difficult to have a decent temperature in the room, difficult to well control the hot water as well.   Breakfast was just OK.  The stay wasn’t worth value for money overall.

The Camino Real Polanco is perfectly located near the main park with museums, a zoo, and castle to spend your day at.  The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms.  The breakfast buffet had many choices of both hot and cold food.

Everything about this hotel is fantastic! The architecture is iconic, the garden is beautiful and peaceful and food is delicious. The hotel is ideally located, close to really cool neighborhoods, museums, restaurants. I cannot wait to come back again.

there's a reason this place is a hundred bucks per night.  i've been to mexico dozens of times and this is the worst experience. i think they found the rudest people in mexico to staff the front desk. locked out of the guest area 4 times they needed my id every time no reasons given. overcharged me 1150 pesos for extra person even though the rate is the same for 1 or 2 people.  polanco is not hurting for cash as evidenced by the fact you can't get into a restaurant at night so the hotel really doesn't need to steal from its guests.  the rest of the staff is ok but there is a weird disconnect betwwen the staff and guests that i have not experienced anywhere else in mexico....sad

I stayed at the Camino Real Polanco in the late 1980s, and chose this hotel in Mexico City to return to this year. Although the good was excellent in both the Spanish Restaurant and the Beefbar, the "music" was far too loud even when made quieter, and it was totally inappropriate, being "boom, boom", not relaxing at all.  The staff in the Beefbar were very noisy, did not seem to have been taught the appropriate way to address diners when speaking to them or in how to behave, and I think this has to be lack of training - or of knowledge - on the part of the restaurant manager who although present, did not ask his staff to be quiet.  I could not recommend the Beefbar to anyone.  the bedding on the bed was far, far too heavy and hot.  I had to request on my different stays over

This is still the best hotel in Mexico City, despite all the new competitors.  It is extremely spacious, most rooms are very quiet and have a spacious balcony, it is the only hotel in Mexico City that is architecturally significant.  The service is friendly, although maintenance is a little spotty.  However, in the post-Covid world, where space and aeration are key, this is the best choice.

I did not expect that I would enjoy our stay so much. From the moment we walked in, everyone was so friendly and helpful and made us feel so welcomed. The 60’s decor was so atmospheric, and it is wonderful that the hotel kept their original look from the time it was build tor the 1968 Olympic Games. Even the elevator music fit the vibe. The room is very large and comfortable. The beds were wonderful and the sheets were changed daily. The shower was great. Breakfast was served in the 5th floor lounge and the selection was plentiful. We also enjoyed the pool. I also want to mention that the concierge Jorge was so helpful and friendly and helped us arrange for a car and driver to Puebla. Oh, and when we needed a COVID test, someone was up in our room in 20 minutes (we were probably

Walking distance to great residential / restaurant / museum / shop areas (Polanco, Juárez, Roma, Condesa), this iconic hotel still casts a magic spell with its great art (Tamayo mural, Goeritz sculptures), architecture, beautiful gardens, pool and gym. Go in through the main entrance and the big city bustle is forgotten.

We arrived approximately 2 hours before check in. Was told Blue Bar opened at 1:00. It did not open at 1:00.   Hotel was taken over by GSK meeting/convention.   Unable to watch television. Only option available was to stream your own apps. Unfortunately, the app we use at home (YouTube TV) is not available for use in Mexico.   I usually have my first cup of morning coffee in room. No in room coffee maker available.   There was a mini bar in room. We had no access to it and were not offered access at check in.     We were out all day one day. Got back to hotel approximately 5:00 pm. Room not cleaned yet.   Planned to have a drink after dinner at the Blue Bar on Sunday, 6/26. Bar was closed again.

Great place to spend your holidays or simply for take a business trip. The workers are very kind and humble. The food is delicious, the installations are clean, the location is excellent. Excellent!!!

I booked a room that explicitly said ‘very good breakfast - that is how it advertised in the booking.com site. Instead, we were given a fairly standard continental breakfast. The ‘very good breakfast’ I thought we were getting is 557 MXP. The one we were giving is 280 MXP.  The approach taken in the way the room is sold is clearly MISLEADING. I don’t really have time to put this as a complain to the UK Advertising Standards against booking.com but will proceed in that direction if this is not resolved.

91 pesos for an orange juice was my first awe at this nice place with huge gardens, a heated open pool, and a 5 minute walk to my huge hotel room. The floor lamp didn’t work and the toilet is super noisy. The bed, linens, pillows and black out curtains and resuced noise coming from the outside were the most positive aspects of my stay. Will return with my family some day.

As foreigner I found quality of service overall at good level. Be prepared that staff beyond reception desk doesn't speak English or any other language - only Spanish. Acoustic separation between the rooms and corridor is terrible - you will hear any noise or neighbor showering. This is annoying and disturbing during the sleep. Hotel is located in good area, close to nice parks and around o.5 km from many restaurants.

The staff is welcoming and Gustavo made sure we were taken care of from start to finish, including arranging in-room covid tests for our return to the US. We also had lunch and breakfast in La Huerta - It may look like a buffet but it is well beyond this! Many many dishes from around Mexico and the wait staff are more than happy to guide you to these delicacies - it is well worth a try. We stayed in a courtyard room facing the pool. It is a lovely view and the rooms were spotless and kept to the late 60's vibe that makes this place a design destination. We splurged on in room coffee and fruit and the service was also prompt and elegant. Cannot wait to return.

Why go cheap on drinking water? Why not offering cold water when folks arrive?  It is really not a huge cost and it makes a difference.  Room amenities need work.  I can not recall a 5-star hotel I have stayed at that does not offer a coffee machine (Nespresso even), and that gives you 2 small bottles of water (tepid water that is).

The place is very well-ran I had a great time and the people are caring. The gym was a plus for me as it was small but well equipped it was also very clean. Camino Real is a great experience and the architecture is exquisite.

Good hotel with all faciltities. Top location, comfortable, all facitilties in house. Great breakfast, good restaurants and lots of facilities to mix business and pleasure. Friendly personel, great service in the middle of town. Hospitallity at a high level. A recomandation if you visit Mexico City.

The Camino Real in Polanco is an excellent option to stay in Mexico City, especially if you need to be in the Polanco area. The building itself is a work of art, designed by one of the best Mexican architects, Ricardo Legorreta. Despite being a somewhat old hotel, it doesn't feel bad because of the beauty of the building and the excellent service from all its staff. I would definitely go back to Camino Real.

Wonderful experience! The hotel is well located, stylish, and the staff and service are top notch. If you’re looking for a departure from the sterile, generic, corporate fare, check out the Camino Real.

The bathroom smelled bad. Long check out process. Two different keys to get to the room. Found a roach in my room. A lot of employees but not efficient. Old hotel and the layout very inconvenient to navigate especially stairs to get to the check in area. How does a handicap person accesses the check out area?

We loved our stay here! The staff was super accommodating to us leaving our luggage after checkout and the hotel was absolutely beautiful and clean and very easy to get to. Also loved lounging by the pool! Would stay again.

Unique design throughout the property. Large rooms. Friendly service.  Good breakfast buffet options. Gym and pool are extremely nice. Great location. Excellent value overall and I would stay there again.

I have stayed here three times in the last 18 months without any complaints.  Room always clean, restaurants and front desk have great customer service.  You  can place orders from Walmart if needed and have it delivered to the front desk.  There are pharmacies, bakery and convenience store within walking distance.

Wonderful stay at Camino Real Polanco Mexico. Thank you to the excellent staff that were quick to respond to any request we had regarding our stay. We loved the architecture, pool and excellent breakfast as well.  Very relaxing. Thank you!

We had a wonderful stay at the Camino Real. The staff was incredibly hospitable and we had everything we needed in a great and safe neighborhood. I would absolutely come stay here again and would recommend it to my friends. I also appreciate their baggage storage service pre and post check-in/out.

Camino Real Polanco has been a consistently great hotel for decades. For over 35 years, I have been coming to it since my parents brought me here as a child, and it never disappoints. The staff is discreet and efficient and the Club is great. It is a quiet hotel in the middle of one of the busiest areas in town and by far the best choice compared with the series of busier, noisier, and traffic-heavy ones along Campos Eliseos. The architecture of the building and the Tamayo mural on its main lobby is just fantastic. Easy place to come to for business, vacation, and with or without kids.

Camino Real Polanco is a 4-star hotel masquerading as a 3-star. It is clean, roomy, quiet and very centrally located. The staff there is the best. Extremely customer focused, fulfilling our requests at a blink of an eye (it helps that there are lots of them), and always with a smile. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again without hesitation.

I attended last week business meetings into Mexico City and Camino Real is a great option and exceptional customer service for business travelers. I totally recommend the Lounge breakfast is awesome, ask for this during your reservation and you wont regret it!

Great vintage design hotel in CdMX, built in 1968. Rooms are spacious, pool area great. Great breakfast on the 5th floor and equally great cuisine at the Japanese and the Spanish restaurants on 2nd floor. Good location nearby the park which hosts the Modern Arts museum and Museum of Antropology. Recommended!

The hotel is very neat and chic and complies with high standards. The room was handed over and maintained in an impeccable state. Staff is highly courteous and engaged to solve any occurring inconvenience. The breakfast buffet was adequate. The hotel is located in a pleasant environment and close to famous CDMX-sights. I'll highly recommend this hotel.

Wonderful location and architecture  but dated. This hotel is in the best possible location next to Chapultepec Park and walking distance to Masaryk St with lots of restaurants and stores.  The hotel is in a beautiful building which was built for the 68 Olympics. The lobby is beautiful. The bar and restaurants are nice and the pool area is very nice.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because our room and bathroom had a musty odor and even after complaining to housekeeping and the front desk they didn't do anything or change our room. Onour final day we saw plumbers working next to our room.  Also the staff other than the concierge were not very friendly.

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel.  I will not go back and can not recommend anyone stay here.   First the good:  the lobby is nice and modern, lots of people working there, the gym looked good - I did not use, and the pool area was relaxing.  Everything else was disappointing.  The room decor was very worn and dated.  Purple carpet, old furniture, old mattress that was hard.  Our view out the window was of a white wall about 10 feet away.  The bathroom was dated and a bad layout.  The toilet made the most horrible screeching noise when flushed - my husbad is handy but not a plumber  - he was able to adjust a hose or something which made it slightly better.   Overall room dark and gloomy.  You have two keys which is more annoying than one would think -mostly because the keys are

This place was the perfect location. Within walking distance to parks, museums, food, shopping, and the hotel itself was awesome. Good quality beds, linens, TV and Internet. We got excellent room service and the cleaning staff actually cleaned! We enjoyed the stay and will stay again.

My family has long been staying at this hotel, since it's opening really, yet THIS time it looked worn down and old. I had an unpleasant surprise after check in to see them place a hold - at check in I signed an open voucher, as usual, yet this time I saw it post on my bank account and it was for double the amount of our expected stay with the accompanying deduction to my account! They said "this is our procedure".... Anyway, the hotel was just OK, food in the coffee shop was quite bad, inedible enchiladas were super salty and Latte Coffee was insipid. Upon check-out they charged for our stay so now there were TWO deduction to my account and here I sit on Oct 19 still waiting for the initial hold to fall off my account! The hotel said "have your bank take care of it", shifting

Camino Real Polanco in Mexico City is known for its art and architecture. However it is a hotel, not a museum, and in hotel services it leaves much to be desired.   Upon arrival, we needed a doctor and had a name and phone number. The first concierge we asked to make a call to the doctor because we do not speak Spanish, not only failed to help but also made us feel as if we were imposing on his time.  There were a number of frustrations, including our key cards being cancelled twice during our 10 day stay.    The most annoying occurrence was when we returned to our room at 3 pm on our last day to find the maid in our room. We asked her to leave and come back later as we were getting ready for an early dinner. When we returned at 6:30, the room was not made up. We called

It’s an incredible restaurant with one of the best service I’ve had in Mexico, it’s really interesting the way they treat the guests. Food is really good, better than other 5 starts restaurants ! Thank you Carlos and Geraldo

The staff has been absolutely forthcoming, patient and professional from the moment we arrived until our departure: front office, concierge, lobby and business center. The hotel is well situated and has great restaurants as well!

They surpassed my expectations. Every little detail was great. I will for sure return they have a good location , food was very great, I really enjoyed my stay! recommended for business, family and friends.

Eleven of us stayed here for 6 days. We came to Mexico City to celebrate our Grandmas 100th Birthday. The service is Amazing. The person in charge of the drive up entrance Angel was very kind and professional. He made sure we always had the right transportation and how to get us there. Every one in reception was also very professional. You can exchange dollars right at the front desk at going rate which was very convenient. The included breakfast at the Huerta was so incredible. first class food and service. Anything you need you just ask for it if its not in the buffet. I asked for juices every morning. If they have the ingredients they will make it and bring it out. All the servers where great and polite. Some of the names I remember where Adan, Ignacio, and Armando. There

Unbelievably excellent service in the first floor restaurant. I want to highlight Nacho, Adan, and Jousian for making my experience there amazing. They make you feel like you are the only person in the world. They also know everything there is to know about the food that is being made and by the end of your trip they know you are coming and what you like. The best kind of service!

Went to to Mexico City for a weekend and stayed in this hotel and we were so pleased.  Our room looked at the garden and pool area which was great as it was quiet compared to the busy city of Mexico.  The location is outstanding, close to shops and restaurants.  We liked the sushi restaurant at the hotel and the price was pretty good.  The pool and fitness center were great but we loved that the room was nice and big compared to other hotels.  We will be returning to this hotel as soon as we can.  Thank you for making our trip great.

Best architecture ever, expansive grounds with big trees, good swimming, secure, friendly employees, perfect location if you want to walk to Chapultepec Park or Reforma.  Not far from Masaryk, a street with excellent restaurants.

We spent 3 lovely nights at Camino Real Polanco, an architectural gem and a wonderful example of gracious hospitality.  The dining experiences were as nice as the guest rooms.  Staff was professional, friendly and knowledgeable (and bilingual).

The hotel wows with its monastic architecture, but the rooms are dated and without any amenities whatsoever. the eames chair in the corner is a cheap knock-off. But the worst thing is the hotel staff. arrogant reception, completely unhelpful in an emergency situation; l would expect a different outcome as a tourist far away from my home country, from the place which hosts me for my stay. the hotel not worth it's rates.

Great old school hotel for a taste of old style and grandeur.  Perhaps not the most modern of places but still a nice experience.  Reception could be more welcoming, felt cold and busy dealing with other things. Check-in was a bit difficult for some reason - we booked a junior suite for more space to work and lounge, but as room window faced a wall we asked for another option - unhelpful reception made this process difficult, same throughout with every small issue eg reactivating room keys that kept getting inactivated for some reasons.  Felt like we were bothering them each time. Pool staff and exec lounge staff were great. Exec lounge was fine in terms of food choice and lounge area. Pool area is superb - ideal for a coffee while sitting back and working on your laptop.  Wifi

For being an older hotel, it was solid.  Room was clean. Food was good.  Staff was helpful.  Gym was good.  Close to other points of interest, stores, and restaurants.  About 25-45 minutes from CDMX airport depending on the time of day.  Plenty of food choices on site. At least on the 3rd floor, windows are left open for air flow reasons.  Keep in mind the city's air pollution is bad, and if you're not used to it, you will get sick one way or another.

Camino Real is a clean, comfortable, safe hotel with a great staff.  I am a retired accountant who stayed in this hotel many nights on business in the late 90s and was excited when my wife booked it for a recent personal trip. It lived up to all my memories and expectations. This hotel compares very well to other good hotels I have stayed at in Mexico, the US, and elsewhere in the world.  The hotel has a fairly conservative feel. The common areas are spacious and well maintained. The rooms are also of a good size and quality of appointments, and they are very clean and well maintained.  This hotel is neither rustic nor over the top modern. It is just a nice, comfortable place to come back to after being out in the big city, and it has a solid, timeless feel.  The staff was

Huge hotel. It's like a maze. The food was greta, the service too, the rooms are not as well kept and dated, e.g. I had a room with beige covers on the bed, orange pillows, a purple rug, anda wooden background, ugh

Fantastic hotel. wonderful architecture With amazing colours . Location is perfect! The service is very friendly; specially Genaro, our breakfast waiter; very friendly and attentive !!the breakfast buffet is breathtaking and the bar is perfect to relax with a nice drink!

I stayed here once as a child, and twice with my wife.  Each time has been great.  The property is well maintained, and the staff genuinely warm.  The location is good for venturing to many parts of Mexico City, a city that we love.

Paid for a deluxe king room and upon arrival they wanted to give me a double bed room. After showing them I paid for deluxe king I was given old outdated room. Bed was horrible, no coffee maker, no key for the mini bar, lights were not working & blues burnt out. My business partner paid less and was given a room with new upgrades, wall mounted TV, nice chair to relax, coffee maker and balcony. On the stay. Love the location, the staff is always very nice and provide great service to guest. The breakfast was good and the products offered very fresh.

Wonderful place to stay in Mexico City. Outstanding restaurant Morimoto inside the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and clean. The pool is heated. The gym is well provisioned with treadmills, ellipticals, dumbbells, and more.

We came to look from the outside and loved it so much we booked a stay for when we returned to CDMX. It was everything we hoped for and more, it's such a beautiful hotel with so much character. We liked it so much we have booked to stay again this year :)

Very nice Hotel in CDMX city center, have 3 restaurantes, bars, shops, wonderful breakfast, pool, gym…etc…nice and very spacious rooms. Impeccable service. Large lobby’s, magnificent entrance, and is like the same in Aeroporto Camino Real.

Had a club room. Very nice and helpful concierge, rooms are little dated, just one fix shower over your head (no hand shower, no bidet, no hygienic shouwer!), very good room service, poor breakfast in a dark restaurant for club room guests (they renovate the lounge now), you have to pay a surcharge (the full breakfast fare) when you want to take the breakfast in the La Huerat restaurant, which is really great there and they want to charge about USD 10,- for extra wishes for eggs in the "club restaurant", what a shame. You hear the neighbours in your room and also the shower as well as closing the wooden closet  ... and you hear through the night the serving trolleys on the floor ..., the housemaid didn´t clean proper the room, no vacuum cleaner was used in my three days to clean

Our experience on the Camino Real was incredible!  7 days at the timeless hotel!  very well located!!!  stylish, contemporary, very careful in the details, ‘blue lounge bar’ makes the difference, beautiful atmosphere right at the entrance! highlight: very careful breakfast, really tasty fruits and tasty breads!  spacious room, great bathroom!  count on concierge service: Jorge Ortiz was very careful with the orders we received and recommendations for restaurants and tours! Anyway, excellent experience we had this week! Recomend!!!!

My first two nights at the Camino Real were not pleasant as I was placed in a room next to a very loud street and was unable to sleep properly. Thanks to Uriel, a very helpful employee working at the front desk, I was able to change rooms after the first two nights. My stay at the hotel then became much more pleasant and I enjoyed the rest of my stay.

Service was uneven and disappointing. Taxi help good. Concierge on two occasions promised to make dinner reservations and we never heard back. Housekeeping ok not great—no bath mat etc. Need English speakers!
